pullRequest.title: Create LoadFlowResultJsonModule
pullRequest.bodyText:
Signed-off-by: HOMER Etienne etiennehomer@gmail.com
Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements (please use '[x]' to check the checkboxes, or submit the PR and then click the checkboxes)

 The commit message follows our guidelines
 Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
 Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

Does this PR already have an issue describing the problem ? If so, link to this issue using '#XXX' and skip the rest
No.
What kind of change does this PR introduce? (Bug fix, feature, docs update, ...)
This PR adds the LoadFlowResultJsonModule class for JSON serialization and deserialization.
What is the current behavior? (You can also link to an open issue here)
The class is absent.
What is the new behavior (if this is a feature change)?
The class is created. It's possible to use it for JSON serialization and deserialization.
Does this PR introduce a breaking change or deprecate an API? If yes, check the following:
No.

commit.message:
Temporary hack: make constructors public for Serializer et Deserializer

Signed-off-by: HOMER Etienne <etiennehomer@gmail.com>

UT for LFResultJsonModule + remove temporary changes

Signed-off-by: HOMER Etienne <etiennehomer@gmail.com>

Change back variable logs to log

Signed-off-by: HOMER Etienne <etiennehomer@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: Please update the copyright year. Is the copyright iTesla or RTE btw?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@
+/**
+ * Copyright (c) 2018, All partners of the iTesla project (http://www.itesla-project.eu/consortium)

nodes.bodyText: You should also test that you can deserialize the string properly through an ObjectReader.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@
+/**
+ * Copyright (c) 2018, All partners of the iTesla project (http://www.itesla-project.eu/consortium)

nodes.bodyText: Agree: a good and complete test will do a complete round-trip. I think you should also update the LoadFlowResultSerializer::write and LoadFlowResultDeserializer::read. In these two methods we create manually the module: if you replace this part by the module you have just created you will cover your new code.

commit.message:
Use LoadFlowResultJsonModule for module registration

Signed-off-by: HOMER Etienne <etiennehomer@gmail.com>
